Row.Text: You really think that will work? Ha! We'll teach you a lesson.
We once defeated aliens with plasma weapons. You think we couldn't defeat you?
XCOM doesn't bow down to those who are stronger, and we win.
An alien empire with superior technology couldn't beat us. Let's see you try.
Really? Well, it's your empire you're losing.
Don't think our strength will make us overconfident. We'll use every ounce of it to defeat you.
Sigh. Well... I guess that's XCOM, baby.
Don't think you've really defeated us. Have you seen the plot to XCOM2?
So it seems there are other humans on this planet. XCOM greets you, then.
Hello, and welcome to XCom HQ. What can I help you with?
Good day. Do you have a proposal for cooperation with XCOM?
Let's get down to business.
Do you have a proposal for us?
Oh it's you. What do you want?
Well, look what the cat dragged in. You want something?
You're lucky my soldiers are disciplined, or someone would have already shot you.
Let's get this over with.
We see your troops creeping up on our borders. If you know what'd good for you, you'll back off.
You have been settling in lands XCOM planned to use for future expansion. I would recommend you choose some different sites for expansion.
XCOM feels than an open borders agreement would serve both our interests.
Let us exchange open borders, so that we may cooperate on military matters.
This deal served both our interests. Let us renew it.
XCOM would like to continue the advantageous exchange of resources.
This deal no longer seems fair to XCOM. We might be willing to continue it, if you offer us more...
Unfortunately, this deal will not work anymore. Unless you're willing to up your offer...
The wealth of your people is impressive. In the future, XCOM may want you as a funding country.
The prosperity of your empire impresses XCOM. Perhaps you will share some techniques with an ally?
The strength and skill of your military has impressed my soldiers. We will be glad to fight at your side in future conflicts.
XCOM values the strength of an ally such as you.
XCOM was founded to defend humanity from aliens. But if you push us... a human threat would probably work too.
XCOM has seen the wars you've started recklessly. Just a warning.
Let us make a Declaration of Friendship.
Let us let the world know that you and we stand together.
I too have made a Declaration of Friendship with {1_CivName} as well. Cooperation like this is what enabled humans to defeat the alien threat.
We have made made a Declaration of Friendship {1_CivName} too. United we stand, divided we fall.
It is good that you understand the value of dependable allies. XCOM is friends with {1_CivName} too.
{1_CivName} is a friend of XCOM as well. Let us work together in the name of mutual security.
XCOM wishes to exchange embassies to facilitate mutual understanding and security.
Let us exchange embassies to facilitate diplomacy between our factions.
XCOM would like to send an embassy to your capital, to facilitate mutual diplomacy.
XCOM would like you to exchange an embassy in the name of mutual understanding.
We discovered your spy trying to steal proprietary XCOM technology. We dealt with the spy properly.
You really think you could infiltrate XCOM. Let the fate of your spy serve as a warning to others.
It is good to have allies. Together, we will annihilate {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}!
We thank you for your assistance against {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}. XCOM is glad to be friends with you.
Okay.
That is acceptable.
We agree.
Very well.
This works.
This deal is acceptable.
That is a generous offer, and I accept.
I accept this friendly offer. XCOM will remember your support.
Yes?
Are you going to say something?
Do you have any good ideas?
Sorry, did you say something?
Okay?
I don't think we can take that deal. Let's talk some more...
I'm sorry, but that deal is unacceptable. Perhaps if you give us a bit more...
I thought this was a discussion about fair deals. If you want direct assistance, then ask for that.
To be frank, it is a bit insulting to think we might accept a deal like that.
Alright.
That sounds good.
Let us make a mutually beneficial trade.
XCOM is willing to exchange some of its resources for yours.
How about this deal?
I'm sorry, that is not on the table. Let's talk about something else.
Sorry, we cannot trade that. Let's talk about something else.
Thanks.
Thank you.
We are deeply obliged to you.
Thank you.
You have our gratitude.
XCOM will remember your cooperation.
Hmm, well it's your right to decide, I suppose.
That is disappointing.
It's your right, I suppose...
XCOM appreciates the return of our civilians. Your generosity will be remembered.
Thank you for returning our civilians. XCOM will not forget this.
XCOM owes you a debt for the civilians you have returned to us.
The civilians you have returned will go a long way towards to improving your reputation around the base.
No, I cannot accept peace. XCOM still has business to settle with you.
Tired of the war already? There will be no peace yet.
Your provocative and reckless actions have gone too far. XCOM is warning the world of your perfidy.
The world will know the depths of your fecklessness.
XCOM is denouncing your actions, in the faint hope that you will change your behavior.
{1_PlayerName:textkey} has been a thorn in our side for far too long. Will you join me in declaring war?
{1_PlayerName:textkey} has become a danger to us all. Shall we declare war together?
The actions of {1_PlayerName:textkey} have gone too far. It is time for us to end this.
Oh, it's you. I guess the comms officer made a mistake again. I don't know how; I'd never talk to someone like you.
If you had been around during the alien invasion, the aliens would have conquered country in a week.
Hmm...you know, if we ever go to war, I think I might try it with only one squad, just to be fair.
I wonder if the skyranger crew could defeat you on their own.
I'll say one thing for EXALT-they had better taste in art than you.
We look forward to your defeat in this war.
What do you want? I'm surprised you even dare talk to me.
I know when I am losing. What will it take for peace?
I've lost too many operatives to this war... please, let us have peace.
The costs of this war have been too high. Please, let us negotiate peace.
XCOM is no stranger to being falsely condemned. Rest assured it will have no effect on us.
Being denounced by you is like being denounced by the Ethereals. Utterly meaningless.
I suppose I shouldn't be surprised. You do seem like a liar.
I suppose you think lying to the world will accomplish much? They know the truth.
I hope the rest of the world can see through your transparent lying.
I can't give you enough to make this fair.
Don't make me repeat myself.
I told you, this won't work.
Stop reoffering the same deal!
Hello again.
If you want to join XCOM, you can fill out form 3D. Otherwise, stop coming back here.
XCOM needs partners in its research.
I don't I can trust you again after you broke our promise to go to war.
Always nice working with you. What do you want to discuss?
{1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} continues to be a problem. Can you help?
We may need help with {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}. Well, what do you want to talk about?
Good luck with your war, I think. What do you want to talk about?
I hope your war isn't going well. What do you want?
XCOM could use your assistance.
I told you no...
Your acuqisition of land near XCOM has caused great concern. You should be more careful.
I have to tell you that you can't keep buying land like that, or there will be repurcussions.
You promised to stop acquiring land, and you broke it. I will remember the value of your promises in the future.
It's finally over.
I hope this foreshadows a new era of peace.
I'm tired of taking these losses. Let's end this war.
I think it's time we stopping fighting.
Opening our borders to each other will enhance mutual security.
I see you're trying to become friends with, uh, {1_MinorCivName:textkey}. XCOM is capable of protecting them without additional assistance.
Trading some luxuries would improve everyone's living standards.
We have kileld one of your spies trying to steal our secrets. I would recommend you not try that again.
XCOM was protecting {@1_MinorCivName}. Your conquest of them serves as a major provocation to XCOM.
We apologize for the operative that was caught in your territory. We hope you will overlook this unfortunate incident.
With how unhappy your people, you'd think they were being ruled by aliens.
You know that a strong population the heart of a powerful nation, right?
If you want your people to have anywhere to live, you have to found more cities. Just some advice.
It is only natural that a facility as advanced as XCOM can spread its culture beyond its borders.
I hope that my people's adoption of your customs doesn't become a security hazard.
Thank you for supporting our proposal to the World Congress. I look forward to working together on future initiatives.
Thanks for making XCOM the leader of the World Congress. XCOM will do its best to make its leadership justified.
Thanks. Dr. Vahlen really likes artifacts.
XCOM is not pleased by this offense.
Your archaeologists have been spotted in our territory digging up historical artifacts. I already have a team working on those artifacts, so please stop.
Alright, I guess we won't dig anymore.
Sorry, XCOM needs all the intel it can get.
I hate door-to-door preachers. Don't you? Can you tell your missionaries to cool it?
Thanks. My operatives don't like being preached to.
XCOM is not fond of fanatics...
No. Come on, it's just some priests. It's not like it matters at all.
Alright, if you're going to ask, I guess I should.
Well, I can't do anything about that.
Thank you.
You voted no our proposal at the {1_LeagueName}. I had more cooperation for the common good than that.
I'm glad you understand.
I'm glad we can work together.
I'll remember this.
I don't understand you.
This won't encourage cooperation with you in the future.
I hope you know what you're doing, being friends with {1_CivName}.
I'm glad others also understand the menace that {1_CivName} poses.
You denounced {1_CivName}, but they have always been good friends with XCOM. I'm not sure what happened there.
I agree with you that {1_CivName} is not to be trusted.
If we have to...
If you really need it...
You're going to demand something like that from someone much stronger?
I'm not sure you understand our respective military strengths. Allow me to make it clear. No.
I can't give you help so soon after the last time.
XCOM can't afford to give away that much.
You're asking for too much. No, sorry.
No. Don't try to threaten me.
No. Why would I help you?
You're not even an ally of XCOM.
I'd glad we've reached an understanding.
Well, let the fate of your spies be on your conscience, then.
We forced one of your protected accomplices to give us gold. You want to do something about it?
As I expected.
We'll see about that.
We attacked one of your little protected city-states. Care to do anything about it?
I'm not surprised.
We'll see.
We look forward to receiving your surrender.
If you have nothing to do, stop bothering me!
Go away!
With an army like that, I'm sure someone will get rid of you soon enough.
I suppose with only a few cities you'll be easy to wipe out.
If you keep buying so many tiles, I might have to send in some operatives. Just so you know.
Don't think you can intimidate me with your aggressive expansion. Unfortified bases are easily destroyed.
It is XCOM's destiny to rule this world.
It is XCOM's duty to rule thise world, for the betterment of all mankind.
To get back home, XCOM must have all the resources of this planet.
It is necessary for XCOM to rule this world, so that we will be ready for the inevitable alien attack.
It is necessary for the good of everyone that XCOM conquer this world.
I'm not usually a fan of sneak attacks, but when it has to be done...
I've grown to respect you over the years, and I'm sorry this had to happen.
In other circumstances we could have been friends...I'm sorry it's come to this.
XCOM must take whatever ooportunities present themselves, even at the cost of existing agreements.
XCOM must take whatever chances it can get. Sorry.
XCOM needs more bases. UNfortunately, you're in the way.
XCOM needs as many resources as it can get, including yours.
It is time we dealt with matters on the battlefield.
XCOM has fought wars with long wars before. We must now fight another one.
The aliens once thought they could conquer us with their power. XCOM taught them otherwise.
Sometimes in this world, a little deception is necessary for your great goals. I'm sorry you were in the way.
I suppose, but I hope you realize how much XCOM bases contribute to security.
It's empty land. I don't see why you insist it's yours.
So you don't value alliances at all.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
I want to talk about something important. {1_CivName} must be destroyed, together. I hope you'll do this for me. (WILL DECLARE WAR IMMEDIATELY)
I want to talk about something important. {1_CivName} is a threat to everyone, and we need to tell the world. I hope you'll do this for me.
I understand, but...I hoped for better.
XCOM needs resources. I have to ask that you give it to me.
Your theft of XCOM territory has been noted, and will be remembered.
I understand. We will help you fight.
We are glad to help, but we need to prepare. Give me 10 turns, and I will come to you when ready.
Sorry, but I'm not ready to declare war.
Are you here about the little spying incident?
Don't think I will ignore your bullying of {@1_MinorCivName}. You have to stop.
You think XCOM is weak? You'll soon find out otherwise.
Really? Well, I suppose you might think a surprise attack is the only chance you have.
This betrayal, I... nevermind. XCOM will destroy you.
I can't believe you would do this. I... am sorry my judgment was so poor. XCOM will destroy you.
Don't think I will ignore you attacking {@1_MinorCivName}. You have to stop.
Well now I see how much your promises are worth. XCOM will remember this.
We predicted you would attack. Let XCOM teach you a lesson!
I can't believe you would do this. Well, it's your grave you're digging.
Don't think XCOM will ever forgive this backstab.
We'll see about that.
I'm less surprised than I should be. To war, then.
XCOM sees your units gathering near our borders. I thought I'd let you know your attack isn't a surprise.
I'm sorry, but your alliance with XCOM has proven worthless. It is necessary for us to tell the world.
XCOM is very impressed by your strength, and hopes you will remember that we are only a small special operations organization.
The time has come for war, like you promised.
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} has taken back its guarantee of protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.
{2_MajorCivName:textkey} announces to the world that it is now protecting {1_MinorCivName:textkey}.
Your aggressive expansion into land near XCOM has been noted. I hope you'll consider curtailing it.
We have noticed a number of your military units on our borders, and hope it is not a sign of something.
Your aggressive tile acquisitions will impair relations between us
This war no longer serves any purpose. Let us end it.
You denounced me and still want to talk?
You want to talk to me even after I denounced you?
I'm glad we agree about denouncing {1_PlayerName}.
{1_PlayerName} has been a valuable ally of XCOM, and I'm not sure why you would feel the need to denounce them.
I hope you know what you're doing, being friends with {1_PlayerName}.
It is good to talk to another friend of {1_PlayerName}!
I would say I'm surprised, but I'm not
I guess we'll see.
The people you denounce are usually good allies. I think I need to talk to {1_CivName}.
I can't believe you'd be friends with {1_CivName}. I hope you know what you're doing.
I'm not a fan of those who won't listen to reason
Well I'm glad you're willing to listen.
Thank you for your understanding.
Our spies have uncovered that {1_PlayerName} is marching an army to sneak attack {2_CityName}. I thought you should know.
Our spies have uncovered that {1_PlayerName} is sending an army to attack you. I thought you should know.
Our spies have uncovered that {1_PlayerName} is sending ships to sneak attack {2_CityName}. I thought you should know.
Our spies have uncovered that {1_PlayerName} is sending ships to attack you. I thought you should know.
XCOM operatives conduct operations worldwide, as needed, so no.
Well, after that embarrassment, I supposed we have to.
Listen, someone has been stealing XCOM technology. Can you promise me that it wasn't you?
XCOM would like to know more about your faction before agreeing to be allies.
I'm glad you're willing to show your friendship to XCOM.
Thanks. I appreciate your willingness to listen.
It is the duty of XCOM to defend the world, including against warmongers like you.
Well, I guess I'll just attack you instead, friend. If you were really a friend.
XCOM has accidentally attacked your protected city-state. I'm sorry about that, and hope it won't impact relations between us.
I guess we'll have to disagree about that.
Thank you for your understanding.
I guess we'll have to disagree about that.
Thank you for your understanding.
We accidentally asked for gold from your protected city-state. I'm sorry about that, and hope it won't impact relations between us.
Your World Congress proposal is a clear attack on XCOM, and will not be forgotten.
We were pleased by your World Congress proposal and look forward to greater cooperation in the future.
I'm glad you also understood the need to denounce {1_PlayerName}.
I hope you knew what you were doing, denouncing {1_PlayerName} like that.
So be it.
Strong leadership is the core of survival. Adopt Autocracy, like we have.
We must remember that we defend this world only to defend human freedom. Adopt Freedom, like we have.
The capitalist classes are a leech upon the productiveness of the economy. Adopt Order, like we have.
I can only shake my head at my people's demands for Autocracy. Do they really want me to order them around like that?
All your talk about freedom has confused my operatives. Now they all want Freedom, as if that's possible in an organization like XCOM.
My workers keep going on strike, because of you! I pay them enough money, but they still want Order!
I'm glad we both understand the importance of strong leadership. Autocracy is the way to go.
I'm glad to see you also adopted Freedom. We must remember that we defend this world only to defend human freedom.
I'm glad to see you understand the importance of maximizing our economic production. Let us work on our five-year-plans together.
Thanks for telling me. We will be ready for this perfidy from {@1_CivAdjective}.
